intro: Onosma chorassanica, commonly known as Persian bugloss, is a flowering plant native to the mountains of Central Asia, particularly Afghanistan and Pakistan. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces blue to purple flowers in clusters, which bloom in the summer months. It thrives in rocky and arid environments, showing adaptability to harsh climatic conditions. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
